meanings.definition: Making someone extremely angry or impatient.
meanings.sent1: The slow internet connection was infuriating.
meanings.sent2: The loud construction noise next door was infuriating.
meanings.sent3: It's infuriating when you can't find your keys, but they were in your pocket all along.
meanings.sent4: The constant buzzing of the mosquito was infuriating, like a tiny tormentor.
meanings.sent5: The dripping faucet in the quiet night was infuriating, echoing through the house.

meanings.sent1: The long lines at the grocery store were infuriating.
meanings.sent2: The repetitive beeping sound was infuriating to the ears.
meanings.sent3: It's infuriating when you keep getting the same advertisement on every webpage.
meanings.sent4: The never-ending traffic jam was infuriating, trapping everyone in frustration.
meanings.sent5: The broken elevator was infuriating, making everyone climb the stairs.
